uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize

Class SynthesizeWordModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.module.AbstractModule
      • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.AbstractSynthesizeModule
        • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.SynthesizeWordModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    @AptModule
public class SynthesizeWordModule
extends AbstractSynthesizeModule
implements Module
    Provide the net synthesis from a word as a module.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter

    • Method Detail

      • getShortDescription

        public java.lang.String getShortDescription()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Returns a short description of the module. The short description should explain what the module does without going into details. It should be shorter than 70 characters and must not contain control characters like newlines. The default implementation in AbstractModule returns an empty string.
        Specified by:
        getShortDescription in interface Module
        Overrides:
        getShortDescription in class AbstractModule
        Returns:
        the short description of the module

      • getLongDescription

        public java.lang.String getLongDescription()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Returns a long description of the module. The long description should contain a detailed explanation of what the module does. It might include example invocations, for instance. This desription has no length limit and may contain newlines. The default implementation in AbstractModule returns Module.getShortDescription().
        Specified by:
        getLongDescription in interface Module
        Overrides:
        getLongDescription in class AbstractModule
        Returns:
        the long description of the module

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Returns the name of the module. The name is used to uniquely identify a module. It should be all lower-case with words separated by underscores. It should also be kept simple as it may be typed by a user in order for him to use this module. For example: "example_module".
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Module
        Returns:
        the name of the module

      • run

        public void run(ModuleInput input,
                ModuleOutput output)
         throws ModuleException
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Perform some computation on the values stored in the ModuleInput object and store the results in the ModuleOutput object. To retrieve values from ModuleInput object the ModuleInput.getParameter(String, Class) method can be used. To store values in the ModuleOutput object the ModuleOutput.setReturnValue(String, Class, Object) method can be used. The possible values in both the ModuleInput and ModuleOutput object are determined entirely by the specifications in the Module.require(ModuleInputSpec) and Module.provide(ModuleOutputSpec) method respectively.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Module
        Parameters:
        input - storage of the inputs
        output - storage of the outputs
        Throws:
        ModuleException - On various kinds of errors that prevent the module from working.
        See Also:
        for an example implementation

      • getCategories

        public Category[] getCategories()
        Description copied from interface: Module
        Returns the categories the module belongs to. The categories are used to improve the module overview making particular modules faster to find. If null is returned the module is automatically assigned to the default category.
        Specified by:
        getCategories in interface Module
        Overrides:
        getCategories in class AbstractSynthesizeModule
        Returns:
        an array of categories
